EmailTemplate.subject: Space is limited for Spring Days New York - Register Today!
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
<[[https://www.springdays.io/ehome/spring-days/registration]]> June 20-21, 2017 Microsoft Technology Center 11 Times Square, 6th Floor New York, NY 10036
Register <[[https://www.springdays.io/ehome/spring-days/new-york?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=global-event-spring-days-2017]]> Hi {{lead.First Name:default=there}},
We’re only two weeks away! We invite you to join fellow developers from the New York area for a two-day community event of sample code, demos, real-world technical talks, live interaction and networking with industry peers.
Java 9 is in the air. We’re rapidly advancing the Spring Framework--adding flexibility to the programming model for cloud-native, reactive, and functional workloads.
Don’t miss this opportunity to connect with other Java professionals and participate in technical sessions about all things Spring.
Technical sessions from Pivotal & the Spring Community
Welcome to Java 9 Jeanne Boyarsky, CodeRanch Advanced Spring Boot & Consul Michael Gendelman, Nomura Securities
Live Coding with Spring Boot & Actuators! John Humphreys, Normura Securities Cloud-Native Streaming and Event-Driven Microservices Marius Bogoevici, Pivotal
Microservices Pattern Language Chris Richardson, Eventuate JHipster 4: Bringing together Angular and Spring Boot, Yakov Fain, Solutions Architect, Farata Systems
Servlet vs Reative Stacks In 5 Use Cases Rossen Stoyanchev, Pivotal Test-Driven Development for Microservices Architectures Reshmi Krishna, Pivotal & Vinay Upadhya, Pivotal
Reactive Programming by example Victor Grazi, Nomura Securities Automated Testing for Digital Experiences Using JUnit 5 Mike Koleno, CTO, Solstice
Register now for $200.00 USD, space is limited.
Have questions or interested in hosting? Please contact us at springdays@pivotal.io <[[mailto:springdays@pivotal.io]]>.
We hope to see you there, The Spring Team
